summary: The software project tracking system has been improved for easier project logging, task acknowledgment, and time estimation, with projects categorized for quick prioritization. Stratten's team is currently limited in hours and efficiency, suggesting a gradual shift away from reliance on Stratten while he remains a knowledgeable resource. Role differentiation between SF Admin and Developer is emphasized, with a focus on establishing permissions, security, and optimizing Salesforce. Next steps include regular check-ins, better collaboration tools, and reassignment of office tasks to enhance overall efficiency.

The software project tracking update highlights improvements in task logging, acknowledgment visibility, time estimation, and project categorization. Stratten's team is committed to enhancing project efficiency, with a focus on reducing reliance on him for admin tasks while ensuring proper permissions and security in Salesforce and other tools. Next steps include database audits, optimizing Salesforce, and improving collaboration tools, along with weekly check-ins to address bottlenecks. Additional suggestions involve reassigning office tasks and considering support for finance oversight.

The software project tracking has been improved with easier logging, task acknowledgment, time estimation, and better categorization for efficient prioritization. Stratten's team is currently limited in hours, suggesting a need for pre-planning and eventual reduction of reliance on him for administrative tasks. Role differentiation between Salesforce Admin and Developer has been emphasized, with a focus on permissions, security, and database management. Next steps include taking over admin roles, optimizing Salesforce, and planning for long-term efficiency through regular check-ins and improved collaboration tools.
